Title: toDecimal32OrNull
Description: Like toDecimal32, this function converts an input value to a value of type Nullable(Decimal(9, S)) but returns 0 in case of an error.
expr — A String representation of a number. String.S — Scale parameter between 0 and 9, specifying how many digits the fractional part of a number can have. UInt8.
String representations of type (U)Int8/16/32/64/128/256.String representations of type Float32/64.
String representations of Float32/64 values NaN and Inf.String representations of binary and hexadecimal values, e.g. SELECT toDecimal32OrNull('0xc0fe', 1);.

NoteAn overflow can occur if the value of expr exceeds the bounds of Decimal32: ( -1 * 10^(9 - S), 1 * 10^(9 - S) ).
Excessive digits in a fraction are discarded (not rounded).
Excessive digits in the integer part will lead to an error.
Value of type Nullable(Decimal(9, S)) if successful, otherwise value NULL of the same type. Decimal32(S).
Examples: SELECT    toDecimal32OrNull(toString(-1.111), 5) AS a,    toTypeName(a),    toDecimal32OrNull(toString('Inf'), 5) as b,    toTypeName(b)FORMAT Vertical;
